complexity.technical: 4: Complex multi-phase architecture involving Node.js bundler script, hybrid template loading system, VS Code WebView constraints, and cross-system compatibility
complexity.business: 5: Critical for transforming terminal-based Claude Code into modern VS Code extension with glassmorphism UI - fundamental to user experience transformation
complexity.coordination: 4: Coordinated across build pipeline, runtime detection, path resolution, template generation, and WebView security constraints

outcomes.performance_impact: Enhanced - Single bundled file load vs 15+ fetch requests eliminates network latency and WebView security violations

summary: WebView fetch() security violations â†’ Professional SPA bundling architecture with embedded templates
root_cause: VS Code WebView cannot dynamically fetch HTML files due to security constraints, causing 403 Forbidden errors for component loading

solution.approach: Built complete SPA bundling pipeline: Node.js script reads 15 component files, wraps in <template> tags, injects into index.html, ComponentLoader detects templates first then falls back to fetch for development
key_changes: scripts/build/bundle-components.js: Created professional bundler reading all component HTML files and generating template tags with proper IDs
ComponentLoader.js: Added loadFromEmbeddedTemplate() method with template detection, path resolution, and fallback to fetch for dev mode
MemorySearchPanel.ts: Implemented auto-detection between bundled HTML (production) and dev HTML with proper file existence checking
package.json: Added build:webview script and integrated into prepackage workflow for automated production builds

validation: Bundler successfully processes 15 components into 34KB bundle, template detection works for most components, identified remaining path inconsistency issues

gotchas.issue: ComponentLoader.loadFeatureCards() bypassed getTemplatePath() system causing template ID mismatch - searched for 'components-cards-featurecard-template' but template was 'cards-featurecard-template'
gotchas.solution: Modified loadFeatureCards() to use getTemplatePath('feature-card') instead of hardcoded path, ensuring consistent path resolution

gotchas.issue: Build pipeline clears dist/ during compile, requiring webview bundle rebuild after TypeScript compilation
gotchas.solution: Must run build:webview after compile step, integrated into prepackage workflow

gotchas.issue: ComponentLoader.js grew into monolithic class with too many responsibilities making debugging difficult
gotchas.solution: Identified need for architectural refactoring into smaller focused classes (TemplateLoader, PathResolver, ComponentInstantiator)

lesson: VS Code WebView requires SPA architecture - fight the constraints by working WITH the platform, not against it. Professional bundling beats runtime complexity every time.

key_patterns: fs.readFileSync() + template wrapping - Server-side component bundling pattern
webview.asWebviewUri() - VS Code resource transformation pattern
